label: 七色十三冠
本: The Acceptance of the Ritsuryo Codes and the Chinese System of Rites in Japan. ACTA ASIATICA, 99 . The Tōhō Gakkai . 2010-08
見出し読み: ななしょくじゅうさんかいかん
見出し読み_mod: ななしょくじゅうさんかいかん
説明文: The thirteen grades of caps in seven colors, instituted in Taika 3 (647),  which were meant to be worn at enthronements, on New Year's day, at receptions for foreign embassies, and at certain Buddhist services held in the fourth and seventh months.
